content:
BehaviorDragDropEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the methods that will handle the BeginDrag and EndDrag events of a BehaviorService. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

public delegate void BehaviorDragDropEventHandler(object sender, BehaviorDragDropEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
BehaviorDragDropEventHandler

Remarks

When you create a BehaviorDragDropEventHandler delegate, you identify a method to handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see Events.
